contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Rabies
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Rabies vaccine.

seriesAdminGuidance: The 6 month booster should only be given after a serum sample has been tested for rabies virus neutralizing antibody. The booster should be administered if the serum titer fails to maintain a value of at least complete neutralization of a 1:5 serum dilution by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test.

The 2 year booster should only be given after a serum sample has been tested for rabies virus neutralizing antibody. The booster should be administered if the serum titer fails to maintain a value of at least complete neutralization of a 1:5 serum dilution by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test.

indication.description: Administer to veterinarians and their staff.

observationCode.text: Persons whose activities bring them into frequent contact with rabies virus or potentially rabid animals

indication.description: Administer to persons whose activities bring them into frequent contact with rabies virus or potentially rabid animals.

observationCode.text: International travel with possible contact with animals in areas where rabies is enzootic and immediate access to appropriate medical care might be limited

indication.description: Administer to persons with plans for international travel with possible contact with animals in areas where rabies is enzootic and immediate access to appropriate medical care might be limited.
